item.title: Books of 2025
item.description:
Here are the books I completed in 2025. (Work in Progress)

I was surprised to see that I only finished 3 books that are fiction/sci-fi. Many more were started, including a book of Roland Dahlâ€™s short stories and a collection by Terry Pratchet, but I have yet to finish the whole book so theyâ€™ll go on next yearâ€™s list.

Fiction

SPOILERS

Flowers for Algernon by Daniel Keyes

I loved how the writing style evolved and changed as the characterâ€™s mental capacity grew and shrank. Didnâ€™t like how he wrote the women characters, but that style is pretty standard for the time, so I donâ€™t hold it against him. Great story and concept.

item.title: Hot Takes : Pre-30 edition
item.description:
Pets shouldnâ€™t be treated like people.

They can still be treated respectfully, as pets, but worrying about hurting their feelings by not including them at the table, for example, is going too far. â€žThis is my baby!â€œ No, thatâ€™s your dog. â€žSheâ€™s family; donâ€™t exclude her.â€œ No, thatâ€™s a cat on the table with paws that were just scratching poop in a box. Why do people need to coddle their pets? Why not spend that energy trying to spoil your human friends?
